content: Is it my idea, or is it currently impossible to configure which extensions are allowed in file/add?
...I've looked under admin/structure/file-types/settings and admin/config/media/file-system, but can't see anything that allows that.
@klonos looks like it is per field /admin/structure/types/manage/page/fields/field_j?destinations[0]=admin/structure/types/manage/page/fields
add a file field to a content type and then in the field config you can set the allowed file extensions

In D7, the settings are here: admin/config/media/file-settings In Backdrop, that page does not exist.
Also, the extensions for images are hard coded:

  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3136
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3851

Description of the bug I wanted to allow .svg uploads on backdropcms.org. For logos, I didn't need to use an image style, so I thought this would be okay. I as wrong. Steps To Reproduce I added...

Thanks @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ...I know that you can specify extensions/types per file field in content type + also per file type defined under admin/structure/file-types ...but I need to customize the extensions allowed to be uploaded via the "Add a file" link in "Manage files" ...allowing .zip (or other compressed file types) for example seems like a common use case.

...seems that we need to expose the file.settings.default_allowed_extensions setting in the admin UI: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/1.x/core/modules/file/file.pages.inc#L1077
